channel.title: Article on Voyager Internet Ltd.
channel.description: Recent content in Article on Voyager Internet Ltd.

item.title: How to make money online in NZ
item.description: The internet has enabled a multitude of ways to earn a good living - and most of these can be done from any country, as long as you have a computer or smartphone, and a fast reliable internet connection.

item.title: Voyager Delivers the Message with SMS Text Solution
item.description: From internal staff and emergency communications to engaging with and retaining customers, one of the best ways to get a message across fits right in the palm of your hand.

item.title: Getting the Message: How Businesses Use SMS to Connect with Customers
item.description: We are busy people. Always on the go, with so much on our plates.

item.title: You've got mail: everything you want to know about spam
item.description: Spam emails have been around as long as commercial internet has been available.

item.title: Is the end nigh for copper phone lines? Don’t lose your voice – consider VoIP for business
item.description: With the successful rollout of Ultra Fast Broadband (UFB) across the country, fibre is becoming accessible to more and more New Zealanders.

item.title: Fibre broadband for business - differences and advantages over DSL
item.description: New Zealand has some of the fastest broadband in the world, as indicated by a 2019 study.

item.title: RWC Ready: Don't Just Dream It, Stream It!
item.description: The 2019 Rugby World Cup is just around the corner, and if you haven’t snagged September flights to Japan, then you’ll probably be stuck here watching from home with the rest of us.

item.title: Have Your Kids Lost the Plot? Get Them to Write Their Own!
item.description: Winter can be tough – the weather is fickle, and kids can be stuck inside for days, growing bored and restless.

item.title: We're taking care of business, now 7 days a week
item.description: We’re already chuffed to say that 80% of our support calls are answered within 60 seconds, and from 1st July 2019, we’re excited to announce that our business support hours are now 8am to 10pm, 7 days a week.

item.title: New Zealand’s top news editors cast their predictions for this year’s biggest news stories still to come
item.description: The names of more than 280 finalists in the 2019 Voyager Media Awards have been released today after weeks of judging nearly 2000 entries.

item.title: Why you’re better off buying boutique broadband
item.description: When it comes to consumer reviews, telco companies usually get a pretty bad rap.

item.title: If the internet goes down, we might as well go fishing - A business broadband case study
item.description: If the internet goes down, we might as well go fishing

item.title: Keeping children safe online following a crisis or natural disaster
item.description: Following the horrific attacks which took place in Christchurch last week, there has been extremely distressing content shared online across many social media, messenger, and video streaming sites.

item.title: Meetings in pyjamas: why more Kiwis are working from home
item.description: 49% of New Zealanders work from home as well as their workplace, and over a half of these people would like to do it more often, according to a recent study by InternetNZ.

item.title: Facebook Portal: What is it, why buy it, and how to be one of the first in NZ to get one
item.description: Launched in the US in October 2018, the Facebook Portal is a tablet for your home.

item.title: Be the Yoda of the internet for your kids
item.description: “Always pass on what you have learned” said Yoda. He also said “Unlearn what you have learned” but we’re choosing to ignore that one for the purposes of this blog post…

item.title: The Momo Challenge in New Zealand: Practical Safety Advice for Panicked Parents
item.description: The Momo Challenge has hit New Zealand, causing widespread panic amongst Kiwi parents.

item.title: Could your 10-year-old password end up getting you pwned?
item.description: Your faithful 10-year-old password could be your demise if you end up the victim of a data breach, which is far more likely than you might think.

item.title: Passwords and Privacy, 3 simple steps to keep you safe online
item.description: Three simple steps you can take today (we’re talking right now!

item.title: We’re making noise in 2019
item.description: We’re making some noise and kicking off 2019 with an exciting development from our Voice team!

item.title: Apps to help you smash your 2019 goals
item.description: Mid Jan, and although you still can’t get a park at the gym, it seems as though people’s ‘New Year, New Me’ enthusiasm is already starting to dwindle.

item.title: Switch off this Christmas
item.description: The latest research shows that on average, us Kiwis spend up to 18 hours a week on our mobile phones, that’s a lot of scrolling through Christmas selfies!

item.title: There’s still time to shop online, and these gifts are seriously cool!
item.description: We thought we’d save you the hassle of trying to find a park at Westfield mall, and share with you our top picks for this year’s totally awesome technology gift ideas which you can buy online…

item.title: We've done it again at the Broadband Compare Awards
item.description: We are stoked to report that we came away with a highly commended award for ‘Best Fibre Broadband Provider’ last night at the Broadband Compare Awards.

item.title: NZ businesses targeted by invoicing scam
item.description: New Zealand businesses are being targeted in an invoicing scam, according to a report by CERT NZ.

item.title: Spot the Scammers – How to stay ahead of the hoaxers
item.description: The internet is awesome for connecting people around the world, but in regards to your twice removed cousin needing money in Mumbai, well we’re more than a little dubious…

item.title: Voyager’s Cloud PBX frees employees to work flexibly
item.description: Two very different Kiwi companies, one same goal: save costs and promote flexible working for our employees.

item.title: Kiwi Businesses go Beyond Broadband
item.description: New Zealand will be one of the top five OECD nations for fibre availability by 2022, when 87% of the population will be able to access fibre broadband technology.

item.title: Countdown to Singularity - Life in 2038
item.description: Earlier this year our CEO Seeby Woodhouse attended the prestigious Abundance 360 conference in California.

item.title: Christchurch residents to get double the fibre
item.description: Local Kiwi broadband provider, Voyager, has committed to deliver double the fibre speeds to its Christchurch residential customers, following the southern success of Christchurch fibre broadband network provider, Enable.

item.title: I got 99 problems but GDPR ain’t one…
item.description: Europe’s new General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) has 99 articles establishing new data privacy laws for organisations and individuals.

item.title: What does Net Neutrality mean for my Kiwi Business?
item.description: If you follow US business news you’ll have heard that net neutrality is one of the hottest subjects in Congress.

item.title: Behind the Scenes - What exactly is a Netflix Cache Server?
item.description: Ever wondered how your evening high-definition Netflix viewing or favourite YouTube videos get streamed so quickly, without buffering?

item.title: Switching to Fibre Broadband - Top Five Fibre Fibs!
item.description: 87% of New Zealanders will have access to fibre by 2020, according to a report by the Ministry of Business.

item.title: The Death of Dial Up - join us on a technology trip down memory lane
item.description: Remember this? Click here for a sound journey back to 1989!

item.title: Voyager Media Awards
item.description: If you follow us on social media, you may have seen our CEO Seeby Woodhouse mingling with New Zealand’s media elite earlier this month – not to mention Jacinda and Clarke!
